name: Pope Nicholas V
summary: Nicholas V, born Tommaso Parentucelli, was Pope from 1447 to 1455. He is considered the first Renaissance pope and was a great patron of the arts and learning. He founded the Vatican Library, collecting thousands of manuscripts. He declared 1450 a Jubilee Year, attracting thousands of pilgrims to Rome. He worked to restore and beautify Rome, employing many artists and architects. He tried to organize a crusade against the Ottomans after the fall of Constantinople in 1453, but was unsuccessful. His papacy marked the beginning of the papacy's role as a major patron of Renaissance culture.
